result.execSummary:
The defendant Ben S. Donovan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to obtain/maintain employment that meets with agent's approval.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name and must take exactly as directed to be taken.  

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

No contact with known drug dealers, known drug users or their residences.

Not to be present where controlled substances are used or illegally sold.

No contact with Jessica Collins, Jeremy Garber and Samuel Lucka.

Comply with all other no contacts ordered by agent.

Comply with any rules, assessments and recommendations made by agent.

Defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
